directive_ref: CEO DIRECTIVE WAVE 15/15A - AUTONOMOUS GOLDEN NEEDLE HUNT WITH SOURCE ATTRIBUTION

sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Market reports linked the selloff to renewed fears that the BoJ will tighten monetary policy at its meeting this week, threatening the yen...
Bitcoin slid to the $85000 level on December 15, extending its recent decline as global macro risks, leverage unwinding, and thin liquidity...
During the festival season, the crypto markets, much like traditional financial markets, often lean bullish as liquidity improves,...
Crypto may face major volatility as the US job market weakens, pushing the Fed toward a pivotal December policy shift.
Bitcoin prices pushed lower on Thursday, November 20, extending recent losses as macro variables fueled weakness in the markets.

hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout on Conflicting Catalysts
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 3-day realized volatility < 40% (annualized) and conflicting high-impact news hits (e.g., negative macro catalyst vs. 'Santa Rally' seasonal optimism), the resulting 4-hour breakout direction will sustain for at least 6 hours with a >70% win rate, as pent-up directional pressure resolves.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Current environment has conflicting signals: scary macro catalyst vs. seasonal rally expectations. Low volatility indicates coiled energy. The first clear break often attracts momentum algorithms and trapped directional traders.
entry_conditions: News sentiment divergence score > 1.5 (mixed bullish/bearish headlines)
BTC price breaks 2-hour ATR(14) band to either side

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Reversal back into the 2-hour ATR(14) band

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakouts reverse >50% of the time within 2 hours, indicating false breaks due to low conviction, not catalyst resolution.
